net.hudup.core.data

Class RatingMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.data.RatingMatrix

  • public class RatingMatrix
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a rating matrix contains a set of rows and a set of columns in table form. Each cell is a rating value that a user gives on an item. The real matrix is stored in its public variable matrix. If this is a user rating matrix, each row is a vector of rating values that a user gives on many items. In other words, rows in user rating matrix correspond with users and columns in user rating matrix correspond with items. If this is an item rating matrix, each row is a vector of rating values that an item is received from many users. In other words, rows in item rating matrix correspond with items and columns in item rating matrix correspond with users. In a rating matrix, all values at the same row constitute a row vector and all values at the same column constitute a column vector. Row vectors and column vectors are extracted from the internal real matrix matrix.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

    • Field Detail

      • matrix

        public double[][] matrix
        The public variable for fast access, representing a matrix of rating values. In case of user rating matrix, each row of the matrix is a vector of rating values that a user gives on many items. In case of item rating matrix, each row is a vector of rating values that an item received from many users. This variable is called data matrix or internal matrix.

      • rowIdList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> rowIdList
        Essentially, this variable is a mapping from a column to an ID. It is public for fast access. If this is a user rating matrix, this variable is a vector of user identifications (user IDs) ;for example rowIdList.get(0) returns the same user ID of all rating values at the first row. If this is an item rating matrix, this variable is a vector of item identifications (item IDs). ;for example rowIdList.get(0) returns the same item ID of all rating values at the first row. As a convention, this variable is called row ID list and every its element is called row ID.

      • columnIdList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> columnIdList
        Essentially, this variable is a mapping from a column to an ID. It is public for fast access. If this is a user rating matrix, this variable is a vector of item identifications (item IDs) ;for example rowIdList.get(0) returns the same item ID of all rating values at the first column. If this is an item rating matrix, this variable is a vector of user identifications (user IDs). ;for example rowIdList.get(0) returns the same user ID of all rating values at the first column. As a convention, this variable is called column ID list and every its element is called column ID.

      • metadata

        public RatingMatrixMetadata metadata
        This variable is meta-data of rating matrix which stores additional information of rating matrix. Rating matrix meta-data is represented by RatingMatrixMetadata class. In general, every rating matrix is always associated with a meta-data.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RatingMatrix

        public RatingMatrix()

    • Method Detail

      • createSub

        public RatingMatrix createSub(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> columnIdList,
                              boolean updateMetadata)
        Creating a sub-matrix of this rating matrix. The column ID list of the sub-matrix (specified by the parameter columnIdList is sub-set of the column ID list of this rating matrix. In other words, this static method extracts a child matrix of this rating matrix by shrinking this rating matrix according to columns.
        Parameters:
        columnIdList - column ID list of the sub-matrix which is sub-set of the column ID list of this rating matrix.
        updateMetadata - whether or not updating the meta-data of the sub-matrix.
        Returns:
        sub rating matrix which is extracted from this rating matrix.

      • assign

        public static RatingMatrix assign(double[][] matrix,
                                  java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> rowIdList,
                                  java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> columnIdList,
                                  RatingMatrixMetadata metadata)
        This static method firstly creates a new rating matrix and then assigns all variables of such new rating matrix by specified parameters. Such variables are the internal matrix, row ID list, column ID list, meta-data. Note that there is no deep copying, just only reference assignments. This method is often used as a constructor of rating matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix - specified data matrix assigned to the data matrix of the returned rating matrix.
        rowIdList - specified row ID list assigned to the row ID list of the returned rating matrix.
        columnIdList - specified column ID list assigned to the column ID list of the returned rating matrix.
        metadata - specified meta-data assigned to the meta-data of the returned rating matrix.
        Returns:
        new rating matrix whose variables are assigned by specified parameters.

      • assign

        public void assign(RatingMatrix that)
        Assigning all variables of this rating matrix by variables of specified rating matrix.
        Parameters:
        that - specified rating matrix.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checking whether this rating matrix is empty. A rating matrix is called empty if it has no data.
        Returns:
        whether matrix is empty.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clearing this rating matrix, which means that making this rating matrix empty. A rating matrix is called empty if it has no data.

      • getRowVector

        public double[] getRowVector(int rowId)
        Extracting a row vector at the specified row ID. Note, all values at the same row constitute a row vector.
        Parameters:
        rowId - specified row ID.
        Returns:
        row vector attached to the specified row ID.

      • getColumnVector

        public double[] getColumnVector(int columnId)
        Extracting a column vector at the specified column ID. Note, all values at the same column constitute a column vector.
        Parameters:
        columnId - specified column ID.
        Returns:
        column vector attached to the specified column ID.

      • getValue

        public double getValue(int rowId,
                       int columnId)
        Getting the value at specified row ID and specified column ID.
        Parameters:
        rowId - specified row ID.
        columnId - specified column ID.
        Returns:
        value at cell(row id, column id).

      • transpose

        public void transpose()
        Transposing this rating matrix. Note that a matrix was transposed if its rows becomes its columns and vice versa.

      • apply

        public Vector apply(Vector vector)
        Multiplying (applying) this rating matrix with the specified vector. Of course, the result is a vector.
        Parameters:
        vector - specified vector.
        Returns:
        new vector resulted from multiplying this matrix with the specified vector.

      • save

        public void save(java.io.Writer writer)
        Saving this rating matrix to specified Writer.
        Parameters:
        writer - specified Writer.

      • load

        public void load(java.io.Reader reader)
        Reading (loading) this rating matrix from the specified Reader.
        Parameters:
        reader - specified Reader.

      • updateMetadata

        public void updateMetadata()
        This method updates the meta-data of this rating matrix. Updating is only effective if this matrix is modified. Note, meta-data of rating matrix stores additional information of rating matrix.
